wiki.content:
"Who Is It" is a song by Michael Jackson from his 1991's Dangerous album . The song is, like several of Jackson's most famous songs, about rumors. The song peaked at #6 on the U.S. R&B charts, and #14 on the Billboard Hot 100 when released. Michael Jackson sang it acappella during his 1993 interview with Oprah Winfrey, and the positive reaction to this prompted Sony to issue it as a single in the U.S. instead of the planned "Give In to Me".
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: "Who Is It" is a song by Michael Jackson from his 1991's Dangerous album . The song is, like several of Jackson's most famous songs, about rumors. Michael Jackson sang it acappella during his 1993 interview with Oprah Winfrey, and the positive reaction to this prompted Sony to issue it as a single in the U.S. instead of the planned "Give In to Me".

track.name: Who Is It
comments: Emotions as raw as.... I couldn't find anything as raw as this! [2]
tbh this is probably my favourite mj song
Emotions as raw as.... I couldn't find anything as raw as this!

I'm only just now discovering the "Dangerous" album and I'm so impressed - especially with this song. It's wicked in spite of its meaning. Even though MJ is the undisputed King of Pop, he'll never be popular enough for me. I'm sure if the young generation checked him out and got to know how GREAT he really is, they'd be in love as I am.
This is honestly one of his best songs of all time. Such a masterpiece. [3]
This is honestly one of his best songs of all time. Such a masterpiece. [2]
This song is definitely a precursor to The Weeknd's entire aesthetic.
This is honestly one of his best songs of all time. Such a masterpiece.
great track one of my favorites from him
